text: Male Pijace (in Serbian Cyrillic: Мале Пијаце, in Hungarian: Kispiac) is a village in Serbia. It is situated in the Kanjiža municipality, in the North Banat District, Vojvodina province. The village has a Hungarian ethnic majority (96.37%) and its population numbering 1,988 people (2002 census). ==See also== *List of places in Serbia *List of cities, towns and villages in Vojvodina ==External links== * History of Male Pijace Category:Places in Bačka
title: Male Pijace
